description: No one should have to wonder where their next meal will come from, spare #AThoughtForFood.  Khaana Chahiye Foundation started as a citizen-led campaign in March 2020 to meet the immediate, lockdown-induced food demands of the homeless, migrant workers, daily wage labourers, and other vulnerable populations in the city of Mumbai. A campaign that was powered by the city of Mumbai, was able to serve 66.5 lakh meals and distribute more than 70,992 grocery kits Our migrant relief operation served 6 lakh migrants travelling by railways and road at Mumbai’s 4 key exit points. We soon evolved into a volunteer-driven organization striving to eliminate the problem of hunger in the city.   Through our Hunger Map Project, we have used the latest technology and the wide network of volunteers and community leaders, who have been monitoring the situation on the ground for the past year. In the last few months, the COVID-19 cases have risen sharply, forcing the government to declare a partial lockdown which may soon be expanded to a full-fledged one.  Anticipating the acute food demand, we have begun by serving 2000 meals across micro-clusters and along Mumbai’s arterial roads. We have also tied up with Zomato Feeding India to expand our food distribution.
title: KhaanaChahiye: Mumbai is battling hunger along with Covid-19. Again.

description: On September 28, Hurricane Ian made landfall in Florida and North and South Carolina, causing heavy flooding and forcing thousands to evacuate their homes. The GoFundMe community is coming together to help people who are raising money for immediate emergency relief and long-term recovery. Donate to verified Hurricane Ian relief fundraisers today to help people rebuild and recover. Our Trust & Safety team will continue to update this page with more fundraisers as they are verified.
title: How You Can Help: Donate to Hurricane Ian Relief

description: The next generation of home energy storage is here. SuperBase V is the first and only home energy storage system with semi-solid state batteries for greater storage capacity and superior safety. With dual 120V/240V output, dual input up to 6,600W, the industry's fastest solar charging performance, seamless UPS feature, and customizable systems with up to 64kWh of storage capacity, SuperBase V ensures you are supercharged anytime, anywhere.
title: April's Light The Night Fundraiser

description: This October, GoFindYou, GoFundMe’s platform that celebrates and funds Black joy, is heading back to school and offering HBCU students across the country support for textbooks. The nonprofit, HBCU Scholarship Ride, will be distributing $500 textbook reimbursements, aiming for up to 150 students initially, with the goal of furthering support through ongoing donations.  To be considered for a $500 reimbursement, follow these steps:  1. Launch your own GoFundMe fundraiser for education expenses with the title “HBCU Textbook Fund - Your Name” and include our hashtag #GoFindYouHBCU in the fundraiser description.  2. Then, submit your fundraiser link, which should have received a minimum of (3) donations, and upload proof of enrollment in an HBCU via THIS FORM.  Proof can include, but is not limited to, student ID cards, class schedules, and/or campus bookstore receipts. Reimbursements will be issued in the order received as Amazon gift cards, pending all requirements have been met.
title: HBCU Textbook Fund #GoFindYouHBCU

title: First Plug-and-Play Home Energy Storage System

description: HASSAN: HBCU stands for Historically Black Colleges and Universities. After the Emancipation Proclamation, there was racial segregation, so a lot of these schools were founded during that time. Emancipation was in 1863, and Howard was founded in 1867. These schools were founded to educate and funnel former Black slaves into larger society.  Over time, HBCUs got bigger and started to offer regular classes and things like that. They started building traditions outside of larger America, and those traditions have lasted. These schools still produce a lot of Black professionals—Xavier produces a large number of Black doctors , North Carolina A&T engineers, Howard University business, and Law and Hampton for dentistry. They’re still very important and are traditionally underfunded, so it’s crucial that we make sure we give back to these schools that gave us so much.
title: Hussain is helping students what he couldn't

description: Sarita (name changed) was abandoned by her family after she developed mental disorders. She was preyed upon by abusers and sexually exploited. When a team of the Mauli Seva Pratishthan found her on the streets of Pandharpur, she was seven months pregnant, malnourished, and in extremely poor health. She was provided immediate critical care at Mangav, a safe haven for abandoned mentally ill women run by Mauli Seva Pratishthan. Few months later Sarita delivered a healthy baby boy who is now studying in a school.
title: Help doctor couple rescue abandoned women with mental disorders from streets
